page.title: 01General Review
page.content:
This survey has been conducted by two classes of Barrowby School children, aged 9 to 11 years. Pages 3 to 19 are written by the children and hence are in simplified language and to a large extent reflect children's interests.
Our D block comprises a largely rural area with two centres of population - 1. Sedgebrook village 2. N. Western corner of Barrowby village. The rest of the area is covered with scattered farmsteads. The villages serve both members of the farming community and commuters from the nearby town of Grantham.
The landscape is varied. A limestone escarpment runs along the South Eastern portion of the D block with Continued page 2.
